snippet: The size of the protest in the city of Jiangmen against a uranium processing plant seemed to surprise local officials, who are on the defensive because of safety concerns.
abstract: Hundreds of people take to streets in southern China to protest proposed uranium processing plant that will be the nation's largest for making nuclear fuel when completed.

byline.contributor: Patrick Zuo and Yuan Chang contributed research.

lead_paragraph: The size of the protest in the city of Jiangmen against a uranium processing plant seemed to surprise local officials, who are on the defensive because of safety concerns.

headline.main: Rare Protest in China Against Uranium Plant Draws Hundreds
headline.print_headline: Rally in China Protests Plant For Making Nuclear Fuel
